repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

body:
The roles as introduced in https://github.com/doccano/doccano/pull/333 were designed to be incremental (see table below):

View ↓ / Role →  | Project Admin  | Annotator | Annotation Approver |
---------------- |  ------------- | --------- | ------------------- |
Me               | x              | x         | x                   |
Features         | x              |x          | x                   |
ProjectList      | x              |x          | x                   | 
ProjectDetail    | x              |x          | x                   |
StatisticsAPI    | x              |x          | x                   |
ApproveLabelsAPI | x              |           | x                   |
LabelList        | x              |x          | x                   |
LabelDetail      | x              |x          | x                   |
DocumentList     | x              |x          | x                   |
DocumentDetail   | x              |x          | x                   |
AnnotationList   | x              |x          | x                   |
AnnotationDetail | x              |x          | x                   |
TextUploadAPI    | x              |           |                     |
CloudUploadAPI   | x              |           |                     |
TextDownloadAPI  | x              |           |                     |

As such, it's by design that a user can only have one role on a project. For example, it wouldn't make sense for a user to have both "annotator" and "project admin" roles since the latter grants all the same permissions as the former and then some more.

Could you clarify what is the use-case for granting a user two or more roles on the same project?
@kuraga Is your observation for the new [v1 UI](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/doccano/doccano/master/docs/demo.gif) or the old [v0 UI](https://doccano.herokuapp.com/demo/text-classification/)?
@c-w v1. I have two different `a_user`'s roles on page `/projects/1/members`. (BTW, I get a 50x error on attempt to add the same role for the same user.)
@c-w  Thanks, so, it should be forbidden to create a new role when one exists on a project, update only?

@mymusise Yes, that's correct. Each user/project/role pair should be unique. If this is not currently being enforced, I suspect it's a bug with the v1 UI.

@kuraga That sounds like a bug in the validation logic in [RoleMapping](https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/65e80b89e2cb2de6e7963d70cf0a307c4481ea60/app/api/models.py#L255-L269). The error for that situation should be a 400.

issue.title: MultipleObjectsReturned: get() returned more than one RoleMapping

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
Good day!

I've found an error in my log:
```
nginx_1     | <client ip address> - - [04/Feb/2020:13:09:14 +0000] "GET /v1/projects/1/statistics HTTP/1.1" 200 326 "http://<server ip address>/projects/1/statistics" "Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chr
ome/79.0.3945.130 Safari/537.36" "-"                                                                                                                                                                                                          
backend_1   | Internal Server Error: /v1/projects/1                                                                                                                                                                                           
backend_1   | Traceback (most recent call last):                                                                                                                                                                                              
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/core/handlers/exception.py", line 34, in inner                                                                                                                            
backend_1   |     response = get_response(request)                                                                                                                                                                                            
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 126, in _get_response                                                                                                                        
backend_1   |     response = self.process_exception_by_middleware(e, request)                                                                                                                                                                 
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 124, in _get_response                                                                                                                        
backend_1   |     response = wrapped_callback(request, *callback_args, **callback_kwargs)                                                                                                                                                     
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/views/decorators/csrf.py", line 54, in wrapped_view                                                                                                                       
backend_1   |     return view_func(*args, **kwargs)                                                                                                                                                                                           
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/views/generic/base.py", line 68, in view                                                                                                                                  
backend_1   |     return self.dispatch(request, *args, **kwargs)                                                                                                                                                                              
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/rest_framework/views.py", line 497, in dispatch                                                                                                                          [4/9257]
backend_1   |     response = self.handle_exception(exc)
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/rest_framework/views.py", line 457, in handle_exception
backend_1   |     self.raise_uncaught_exception(exc)
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/rest_framework/views.py", line 468, in raise_uncaught_exception
backend_1   |     raise exc
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/rest_framework/views.py", line 494, in dispatch
backend_1   |     response = handler(request, *args, **kwargs)
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/rest_framework/generics.py", line 282, in get
backend_1   |     return self.retrieve(request, *args, **kwargs)
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/rest_framework/mixins.py", line 56, in retrieve
backend_1   |     return Response(serializer.data)
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/rest_framework/serializers.py", line 559, in data
backend_1   |     ret = super().data
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/rest_framework/serializers.py", line 261, in data
backend_1   |     self._data = self.to_representation(self.instance)
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/rest_framework/serializers.py", line 526, in to_representation
backend_1   |     ret[field.field_name] = field.to_representation(attribute)
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/rest_framework/fields.py", line 1873, in to_representation
backend_1   |     return method(value)
backend_1   |   File "/app/api/serializers.py", line 99, in get_current_users_role
backend_1   |     queryset, project=instance.id, user=self.context.get("request").user.id
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/shortcuts.py", line 93, in get_object_or_404
backend_1   |     return queryset.get(*args, **kwargs)
backend_1   |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/site-packages/django/db/models/query.py", line 403, in get
backend_1   |     (self.model._meta.object_name, num)
backend_1   | api.models.RoleMapping.MultipleObjectsReturned: get() returned more than one RoleMapping -- it returned 2!
```

Doccano 1.0.2 + patch from PR 527 (via Docker compose)

body: Let's mark as `bug` instead of `enhancement` since we have an error (server exception).

rename.from: Can't give a user more than one role in a project.
rename.to: Allow to assign more than one role in a project.

issue.title: Improvement Idea for doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Please read this issue when you want to add the feature to doccano**  
**Please upvote 👍 related issue that let us judge priority .**

We show 👍 if someone upvote, and 🤩 means over 10 vote

## Toward More Practical Annotation Tool

### Annotation

* Display
  - [ ] : Support HTML syntax in Document #35 👍
* Filter
  - [ ] : Arrange Annotation Status and Filter by it #280 👍
* Label
  - [ ] : Provide for setting the order of labels #816
  - [ ] : Group labels by the same color #477
  - [ ] : Support multiple kinds of label set #5 👍
  - [x] : Display shortkey in labels selector (on Annotation page) #834
* Annotation
  - [x] : keyboard shortcut for approval button #718 👍
  - [x] : A button to clear the markup. #631
  - [ ] : Automatically select the sequential characters in the sequence labeling task by the hover. #666
  - [ ] : Show context when annotation. #466 
* Navigation
  - [x] : Redirect to the specific page by id, not by offset. #540 👍
  - [x] : "First" and "Last" buttons #615
* Productivity
  - [ ] : Display the who annotated the document #881
  - [x] : Support Comments when Annotating #1050
  - [ ] : Enable Stats view for non-admins #270 👍
* Portability
  - [ ] : Project export and import #901

### Dataset

* Import/Export
  - [x] : Convert label to label-ID when exporting #295 🤩
  - [x] : Import the exported annotation data and keep the all original info #482
  - [x] : Support JSON format (not JSONL) #454 👍
  - [x] : Make maximum file upload (import) size configurable #708 👍
* Management
  - [x] : Bulk Delete #523

## Toward Advanced Annotation Tool

### Task

- [ ] : Question Answering dataset #81 🤩
- [ ] : Multiple choice question #464
- [x] : Multiple label in sequence labeling #19 🤩
- [x] : Nested Named Entity Recognition #544 👍
- [x] : Relation Annotation #233 👍

### Auto-Annotation

- [ ] : Implements labeling functions (Weak Supervision) #224 🤩
- [x] : Add Auto-labeling #191

## Toward Production Usage

* Deployment
  - [ ] : Helm chart #701 👍
  - [x] : Support doccano v1.x on Heroku #811
* Security
  - [ ] :  [Proposal] Warn and/or fail if default admin's password hasn't been changed #857
  - [x] : Clarify how to set user own username/password in docker-compose for security #748
* Authentication
  - [ ] : Two factor authentication for admin and annotators #756
  - [ ] : Okta OIDC social login is not available #1255 👍
  - [ ] : Google OAuth support #620 👍
  - [ ] : LDAP-Support #560 👍
* Annotation Workflow
  - [x] : Allow user to change another users' annotation #531 👍
* Annotator Management
  - [ ] : Allow to assign more than one role in a project. #537
  - [ ] : Enhance Statistics: Compare Annotators #114 👍
* Accessibility
  - [x] : Multiple language interface #479

body:
Is there an update on this? It seemed like consensus was reached to mark this as a bug instead of a feature, correct? It should not be allowed to add a user to more than one role.

It seems like any user who is currently assigned to a role for a given project already should not show up in the dropdown (or be validated against if selected) for new project member roles.
